New Records: Aaron Judge hit his first home run of the postseason in this game.
Key Match Events: The Yankees scored early, chasing Guardians ace Tanner Bibee in the second inning.
The Guardians responded with a two-run fifth inning to cut the deficit to 3-2.
Aaron Judge hit a game-turning home run in the seventh inning to extend the Yankees' lead to 6-2.
Pre-Game Insights: Gerrit Cole started the game for the Yankees, and Tanner Bibee started for the Guardians.
The series shifted to Cleveland with the Guardians needing a win to avoid falling into a 0-2 deficit.
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt explained his decision to pull ace Tanner Bibee after just 1 1/3 innings.
Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians used eight pitchers on the night, and Tanner Bibee was likely to be available for a start soon after leaving the game.
The series now shifts to Cleveland with the Yankees holding a 2-0 ALCS lead.
Others: The Guardians dropped injured pitcher Alex Cobb from their postseason roster due to a back strain.
